title: Is there a way to pass a URL as a variant?
body:
Ah, texlive....  Sigh.

Many (Murphy's law says that it's actually *every #@%%$! one that I try*) of the texlive mirrors currently have an out of sync tarball for beamer.  This type of problem seems to occur regularly.

The texlive install script uses the URL 'http://mirror.ctan.org/systems/texlive/tlnet' which redirects to a mirror that's close to you (or if you're me, a mirror that's broken...).

I thought it would be nice to add a variant that allowed one to specify the mirror that one wanted to use, like so:

```
spack install texlive scheme=small repository=http://ctan.math.utah.edu/ctan/tex-archive/systems/texlive/tlnet/
```

So I added this:


```
    variant('repository',
            default='http://mirror.ctan.org/systems/texlive/tlnet',
            description='CTAN mirror to use for download')
```

With that in place, `spack install` complains about an 'Unexpected token'.  A strategically placed `import pdb; pdb.set_trace()` leads me to conclude that it's complaining about the ':'.  I tried a couple of other values and discovered other fun things: e.g. if I change the install method so that it glues the `http://` onto the repository string, I end up with this behavior:

```
spack install texlive repository="ctan.math.utah.edu/tex-archive/systems/texlive/tlnet"
==> Error: tex-archive does not match any installed packages.
```

All of this leads me to believe that I'm misusing the `variant` mechanism.

Is there a proper way that I can pass in a URL?

I'm loath to hardcode a particular mirror, but I'm *sooooo* close to doing so....
